name: zirconium

procedures: T1012::[ZIRCONIUM] has used a tool to query the Registry for proxy settings.
T1016::[ZIRCONIUM] has used a tool to enumerate proxy settings in the target environment.
T1027.002::[ZIRCONIUM] has used multi-stage packers for exploit code.
T1033::[ZIRCONIUM] has used a tool to capture the username on a compromised host in order to register it with C2.
T1036.004::[ZIRCONIUM] has created a run key named Dropbox Update Setup to mask a persistence mechanism for a malicious binary.
T1036::[ZIRCONIUM] has spoofed legitimate applications in phishing lures and changed file extensions to conceal  installation of malware.
T1041::[ZIRCONIUM] has exfiltrated files via the Dropbox API C2.
T1059.003::[ZIRCONIUM] has used a tool to open a Windows Command Shell on a remote host.
T1059.006::[ZIRCONIUM] has used Python-based implants to interact with compromised hosts.
T1068::[ZIRCONIUM] has exploited CVE-2017-0005 for local privilege escalation.
T1082::[ZIRCONIUM] has used a tool to capture the processor architecture of a compromised host in order to register it with C2.
T1102.002::[ZIRCONIUM] has used Dropbox for C2 allowing upload and download of files as well as execution of arbitrary commands.
T1105::[ZIRCONIUM] has used tools to download malicious files to compromised hosts.
T1124::[ZIRCONIUM] has used a tool to capture the time on a compromised host in order to register it with C2.
T1140::[ZIRCONIUM] has used the AES256 algorithm with a SHA1 derived key to decrypt exploit code.
T1204.001::[ZIRCONIUM] has used malicious links in e-mails to lure victims into downloading malware.
T1218.007::[ZIRCONIUM] has used the msiexec.exe command-line utility to download and execute malicious MSI files.
T1547.001::[ZIRCONIUM] has created a Registry Run key named Dropbox Update Setup to establish persistence for a malicious Python binary.
T1555.003::[ZIRCONIUM] has used a tool to steal credentials from installed web browsers including Microsoft Internet Explorer and Google Chrome.
T1566.002::[ZIRCONIUM] has used malicious links in e-mails to deliver malware.
T1567.002::[ZIRCONIUM] has exfiltrated stolen data to Dropbox.
T1573.001::[ZIRCONIUM] has used AES encrypted communications in C2.
T1583.001::[ZIRCONIUM] has purchased domains for use in targeted campaigns.
T1583.006::[ZIRCONIUM] has used GitHub to host malware linked in spearphishing e-mails.
T1598.003::[ZIRCONIUM] has used web beacons in e-mails to track hits to attacker-controlled URL's.
T1598::[ZIRCONIUM] targeted presidential campaign staffers with credential phishing e-mails.

description: [ZIRCONIUM](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0128) is a threat group operating out of China, active since at least 2017, that has targeted individuals associated with the 2020 US presidential election and prominent leaders in the international affairs community.(Citation: Microsoft Targeting Elections September 2020)(Citation: Check Point APT31 February 2021)
